Header: Death toll from measles reached 142,000 in 2018
Content: According to the U.N’s World Health Organization an estimated 142,300 people died after contracting the measles virus in 2018, amid a worldwide epidemic of the virus. Dr. Kate O’Brien, director of the WHO’s immunization, vaccines and biologicals department, said that there were 9.7 million measles cases in 2018, up from 7.5 million in 2017. The anti-vaccination movement has made the fight against measles more difficult, with anti-vax advocates “largely spreading misinformation”. A growing and vocal fringe of people opposes vaccinations, believing, contrary to scientific evidence, that ingredients in the vaccines can cause autism or other disorders.
